# PyFixest

> Fast high-dimensional fixed effects regression in Python, closely mirroring the syntax of the R package fixest.

PyFixest supports OLS, IV, Poisson, GLM (Logit/Probit), and quantile regression with high-dimensional fixed effects, as well as difference-in-differences estimators. It provides robust and cluster-robust inference, wild cluster bootstrap, multiple hypothesis corrections, and publication-ready tables.

## Docs

- [Getting Started](https://py-econometrics.github.io/pyfixest/quickstart.html): [markdown](https://py-econometrics.github.io/pyfixest/quickstart.html.md)
- [API Reference](https://py-econometrics.github.io/pyfixest/reference/): [markdown](https://py-econometrics.github.io/pyfixest/reference/index.html.md)
- [Changelog](https://py-econometrics.github.io/pyfixest/changelog.html): [markdown](https://py-econometrics.github.io/pyfixest/changelog.html.md)

All documentation pages are available as clean markdown by appending `.md` to the HTML URL (e.g., `quickstart.html` → `quickstart.html.md`).

## Core API

### Estimation Functions

- `pyfixest.feols(fml, data, vcov, weights, ssc, fixef_rm, ...)`: OLS/WLS/IV regression with fixed effects.
- `pyfixest.fepois(fml, data, vcov, ...)`: Poisson regression with fixed effects (ppmlhdfe algorithm).
- `pyfixest.feglm(fml, data, family, vcov, ...)`: GLM regression (family: "logit", "probit", "gaussian") with fixed effects.
- `pyfixest.quantreg(fml, data, quantile, ...)`: Quantile regression via interior point solver.

### Difference-in-Differences

- `pyfixest.did2s(data, yname, idname, tname, first_stage, second_stage, treatment, cluster)`: Gardner (2022) two-stage DID.
- `pyfixest.event_study(data, yname, idname, tname, gname, estimator, att)`: Event study with multiple estimators ("twfe", "did2s", "lpdid", "saturated_twfe").
- `pyfixest.lpdid(data, yname, idname, tname, gname, att)`: Local projections DID.
- `pyfixest.SaturatedEventStudy(data, yname, idname, tname, gname, ...)`: Fully saturated event-study estimator.

### Reporting

- `pyfixest.etable(models, type, ...)`: Publication-ready regression tables (type: "gt" for Great Tables, "tex" for LaTeX, "md" for Markdown).
- `pyfixest.dtable(data, vars, labels, stats, type)`: Descriptive statistics tables.
- `pyfixest.coefplot(models, ...)`: Coefficient plots via matplotlib/lets-plot.
- `pyfixest.iplot(models, ...)`: Interaction/event-study plots.

### Multiple Testing

- `pyfixest.rwolf(models, param, reps, seed)`: Romano-Wolf stepdown adjusted p-values.
- `pyfixest.bonferroni(models, param)`: Bonferroni correction.
- `pyfixest.wyoung(models, param, reps, seed)`: Westfall-Young adjusted p-values.

### Utilities

- `pyfixest.get_data()`: Load example dataset.
- `pyfixest.ssc(adj, fixef_k, cluster_adj, cluster_df)`: Small sample correction specification.

## Formula Syntax

PyFixest uses a fixest-style formula syntax:

- Basic OLS: `"Y ~ X1 + X2"`
- With fixed effects: `"Y ~ X1 + X2 | FE1 + FE2"`
- IV regression: `"Y ~ 1 | FE1 | X_endog ~ Z_instrument"`
- Multiple depvars: `"Y1 + Y2 ~ X1"`
- Stepwise: `"Y ~ csw(X1, X2, X3)"` or `"Y ~ sw(X1, X2)"`
- Interactions: `"Y ~ i(treatment, period, ref=0)"` or `"Y ~ X1 * X2"`
- Interacted FEs: `"Y ~ X1 | FE1 ^ FE2"`

## Variance-Covariance Options

Pass to the `vcov` argument:

- `"iid"` — IID errors
- `"hetero"` — HC1 heteroskedasticity-robust (alias: `"HC1"`, `"HC2"`, `"HC3"`)
- `{"CRV1": "cluster_var"}` — Cluster-robust variance
- `{"CRV3": "cluster_var"}` — Leave-one-cluster-out jackknife
- `"nw"` — Newey-West HAC (requires panel_id and time_id)
- `"dk"` — Driscoll-Kraay HAC (requires panel_id and time_id)

## Model Methods

After estimation, model objects support:

- `.summary()` — Print regression summary
- `.tidy()` — Tidy DataFrame of coefficients, SEs, t-stats, p-values, CIs
- `.coef()` — Coefficient values
- `.se()` — Standard errors
- `.pvalue()` — P-values
- `.confint()` — Confidence intervals
- `.predict(newdata)` — Predictions
- `.resid()` — Residuals
- `.vcov()` — Variance-covariance matrix
- `.wildboottest(param, reps, seed)` — Wild cluster bootstrap inference
- `.ccv(treatment, pk, qk, ...)` — Causal cluster variance estimator
- `.rio(param, reps, ...)` — Randomization inference

## Quick Example

```python
import pyfixest as pf

data = pf.get_data()

# OLS with two-way fixed effects
fit = pf.feols("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov={"CRV1": "f1"})
fit.summary()

# Multiple estimations
fits = pf.feols("Y + Y2 ~ csw(X1, X2) | f1 + f2", data=data)
pf.etable(fits)

# IV regression
fit_iv = pf.feols("Y ~ 1 | f1 | X1 ~ Z1", data=data)

# Poisson regression
fit_pois = pf.fepois("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1", data=data)
```
